lines.text: Yo, Adrian! I DID IT!
It's Apollo.
Who were you expecting?
I was hoping he wouldn't show
How's about investing in condominiums? It's safe.
Condominiums?
Yeah, condominiums.
I never use 'em.

Hey Rock. It's three in the morning. I went up to your house there and they told me you was here. It's 3am, kid. You know that Adrian, she's a good girl. Me, you know I'm sorry for both of ya. There's nothing I can do about it. Except, uh, I wanna tell you this once and then, uh, I ain't gonna say it again. But Rock, you got another shot. This is the second shot. At, uh, I don't know the biggest title in the world, and you're gonna be swappin' punches with, with the most dangerous fighter in the world. And just in case, you know your brain ain't workin' so good. All this happens pretty soon and you ain't ready. You know you're no where near in shape. So I say, for God's sake, why don't you stand up and fight this guy HARD? Like you done before, that was beautiful! But don't lay down like this! Like, uh, I don't know, like some kind of mongrel or something. Cause he's gonna kick your face in pieces! That's right! This guy don't just wanna win, you know, he wants to bury ya, he wants to humiliate ya, he wants to prove to the whole world that you was nothin but some kind of a freak the first time out. He said you were a one time lucky bum! Well now I don't wanna get mad in a biblical place like this, but I think you're a hell of a lot more than that kid! A hell of a lot! But now wait a minute, if you wanna blow this thing, if you wanna blow it, then damn it I'm gonna blow it with ya. If you wanna stay here, I'll stay with ya. I stay with ya. I'll stay and pray. What do I got to lose?
[Mickey has Rocky chase after a chicken as part of his training]
I feel like a Kentucky Fried idiot.
There's one thing I want you to do for me.
What's that?
Win...
Win!
Do you have a criminal record?
Nothin' worth braggin' about.
[to Apollo, about a rematch with Rocky]
He's all wrong for us, baby. I saw you beat that man like I never saw no man get beat before, and the man kept coming after you. Now we don't need no man like that in our lives.
I was wonderin' if, uh, you wouldn't mind marryin' me very much.

[after round 1 of the rematch with Creed]
I can't believe it!
What?
He broke my nose again.
[Rocky, completely tired, exhausted, and in tears of happiness, makes a victory speech to the whole world]
Excuse me. I can't believe this has happened. I can't. And I just wanna say thanks to Apollo for fighting me. Apollo. I wanna thank Mickey, for training me.
We love ya, Rock!
YO, ADRIAN! I DID IT!

[crying in happiness]
I love you. I love you.
Rock, you got anything derogatory to say about the champ?
Derogatory? Yeah. He's great.
[During Rocky's retraining]
You're gonna eat lightnin'; you're gonna crap thunder.
[At a press conference for fight]
His lungs he's gonna punch out.
Now who is that? Al Capone?
I don't sweat you.

[Apollo is reading fan mail]
Mary Anne, you listen to this. "You didn't beat nobody and anybody who knows boxing knows the fight was fixed." This one came from London. "You call yourself the champ? You're a fake! The fight was a fake. Go kill yourself!"
Wouldn't you rather play with the children than read hate mail?
"How much did you get to carry that bum for 15 rounds? You are a disgrace to your people."
Why can't you ignore it?
Are you serious?
[Tosses the mail away in anger]
[Rocky and Mickey are watching the film of the first fight]
Left handed fighters, they're the worst. They lead with their face mostly, trying to throw that big left. Right's no damn good. They ought to outlaw southpaws.
Why didn't you tell me this before?
I didn't wanna hurt your feelings.
[Out shopping with Adrian]
Do you like having a good time? Then you need a good watch!

[noticing Mickey's hearing aid]
What's that in your ear there?
What it is, is I hear stupid things better.
This guy don't just want to win, you know. He wants to bury you, he wants to humiliate you, he wants to prove to the whole world that you was nothing but some kind of a... a freak the first time out.
Can I be honest? No one's going to offer you an office job. There's too much competition. Why don't you fight? I read somewhere you're a very good fighter.
Yeah, well, was ya ever punched in the face 500 times a night? It stings after a while, ya know.
Do you think I beat him the last time?
You got the decision.
Man, I won! But I didn't beat him!
Ladies and gentlemen! In a stunning upset, scoring the win by a knockout, the new Heavyweight Champion of the World...
You're great.
Rocky Balboa!
[Cheering grows louder]
Good luck.

[Just outside doorway of Apollo's hospital room after first fight]
Yo, Apollo?

[In hospital bed]
Yeah, who is it?
Its just me, Rocky. Listen, could you answer me one question?
Yeah, sure
Did you give me your best?
Yeah... yeah.
Thank you.
Why do you have to wear that stinkin' sweatsuit?
It brings me luck, you know?
Brings you luck! I'll tell you what it brings, it brings flies! Now here's what I want you to do... I want you to chase this little chicken.
Hey yo, Mick, what do I got to chase a chicken for?
First, because I said so. And second, is because chicken-chasing is how we used to train back in the old days. If you can catch this thing, you can catch greased lighting.
Well, I'll do it if you say so, but it ain't very mature.
Yeah, well neither are you very mature!
[an exhausted Rocky lands a knockout punch at Apollo but sends them both falling onto the ring]

[shocked]
Oh!
One! Two!
If he gets up, Creed will regain the title! If neither of them gets up, it's a draw and Creed will win the title automatically! The count...
Four...

[calling to Apollo]
Get up, my Man!
GET ON YOUR FEET!

[whispers]
Get up.

[Pandemonium in the stadium grows]
Six! Seven!

[Screams]
Get up!
Eight!
GET UP!
Nine...
[Apollo collapses; Mary Anne moans]

[Rocky at the last second stands up]
TEN! YOU'RE OUT!
[Paulie and Adrian screams in happiness; Mickey yells]
He made it at the last second! Rocky Balboa has shocked the world! He is the new heavyweight champion of the world!
Who the hell is that?
Avon lady.
You know, I never knew you were so light, you know.
No?
No. If I did, I would've carried you everywhere.
[Rocky is punching the heavy bag]
Three, four...
Now remember, I want 500 hard ones. Go!
Where was I, seven or eight?
Rocky, your pay for the fight will be very substantial. What will you do with the money?

Well, the first thing I gotta do is I gotta pay the rent. And then I made this list on our way over here. I'd like to buy a couple hats, a motorcycle, a couple quarts of perfume for Adrian, she likes to smell good. And some muppet toys... you know, Ernie, Big Bird. And the frog, what's his name? Kermit?
Yeah.
And I thought maybe a statue for the church, and a snow cone machine for you, Paulie. You like snow cones, right?
Rocky, do you have something derogatory to say about the champ?
Derogatory? Yeah, he's great.
This place is certanly packed with Rocky's people. I've never seen so many Italians in my whole life!
Hey, you said that, I didn't say that!
We really don't need a car.
Oh, come on, Adrian. I'm gonna be doing commercials. Now, I can afford this, you know? No problem.
Do you know how to drive?
Do I know how to drive?
Do you know how to drive?
I'm one of the greats. Are you kidding? C'mon, I'll drive you. Let me put you inside the car. This will just be like Cinderella and the pumpkin, you know?
Do you know how to drive?
Do I know how to drive? I drive airplanes and bulldozers. I'll drive you crazy if you give me a chance. You know what I mean?
[Chuckles]

[outside after the first fight]
Come on! Right here! Let's finish this fight!
Is he serious?

[after slapping Rocky in the face with his left hand]
Now you didn't even see that comin', did ya? And that's comin' from a broken down punk like me. What... what do ya think the champ would do to ya?
Hurt me bad, I guess...
Na, he'd hurt ya permanent. *Permanent*!

[after round 1 of rematch with Balboa who is fighting right handed]
Alright, did the switching bother ya?
Nothin' bothered me, man, nothin' bothered me.
Well then, you should've had him! Now don't let up on this man. This man is dangerous. This man is DANGEROUS!
This man is dangerous? I'm dangerous! I'm dangerous!
[Duke, Apollo's trainer, is finishing putting tape around Apollo's arm]

[whispers and growls]
You're the Man. You're number one. The Champ, the best of all time. Girls love you - Men, old people love you. Young people love you. You're the best. You're the Man, and he's yours. He's yours, he's yours. This bum shouldn't be in the same ring with you. I want you to show him who you are tonight.
[Apollo practices punching on his right hand]
Show him who you are tonight. Stick him!
You think it'll always be like this?
Yeah.
I hope you...
What?
...you never get tired of me.

[whispers]
Oh, no. You ain't never getting rid of me.
I hope nothing changes.

[whispers]
I ain't changing and I sure ain't never changing nothing about you.
I love you.
I love you, too.
I love you.
[they kiss for a few minutes, then stare into each other's eyes briefly, then kiss some more]
If he goes blind, Paulie, you walk away; I love him, you don't!
I was wonderin' what you were doin' the next 40 or 50 years.

[reading aloud from a book, slowly]
"'It's no time to cuss me,' snarled the robber. 'By God, fellas, grab your rifles and take color... cover.'" How's that sound?
It's good.
Yeah?
Mmmhmm.
Ya know, bein' a good reader's gonna help me get a good office job, ya know. Wanna hear some more?
I can't wait.
OK. "'There ain't no cover, Smokey,' said Brad Lincoln. 'We better head for the canyon.'"
You read nice.
Thank you. You lie nice!
Thank you.
[they both chuckle]

[Standing to his feet after Adrian tells Rocky to win]
What are we waiting for!

[walks in to find Rocky sweeping]
Yo, Rock.
Yo, Tony. How ya doin'?
How am *I* doin'? No, how are you doin'? I heard you was workin' in this dump. What are you doin', Rock? Give it to me straight, Rock.
You know, I'm sweepin' up, makin' a few bucks here and there.
You ain't no janitor, Rock. You don't need a job like this. Besides, you're Italian. Now you come back and work for me, Rock.
Yeah, well, what would I be doin'? You mean like, uh, you know, collectin' or somethin'?
What else? Look, you come back, work on the docks, get some fresh air. It stinks in here.
Yo, Tony, I appreciate the offer, but, uh, I can't do that stuff no more.
It's healthy, huh? Well, look, I gotta go. Take it easy, huh, champ.
Yeah, see ya around.

[pointing to a cardboard cutout of Rocky on the wall when he was a fighter]
Remember that guy, Rock?
What's 'can't'? There ain't no 'can'ts'! There's no 'can'ts'!
[At the wedding of Rocky and Adrian]

[Speaking Italian]
Rocky Balboa, do you take Adrian Ponino to be your lawfully wedded wife?
Yeah. Absolutely. Yes.

[Speaking Italian]
Adrian Ponino, do you take Rocky Balboa to be your lawfully wedded husband?
I do.
Thanks.

[Speaking Italian]
Then by the powers vested in me by the State of Pennsylvania, I now pronounce you man & wife.

[in English]
You may kiss the bride now.
I gotta take this off.
[Rocky draws Adrian's veil back; kisses her]
Go in peace, and God bless you.
Thanks, Father. You done real good. I'm proud of you. Okay, things are gonna be great.
